website_summaries.verdict: With a spacious touch pad, a satisfying typing experience, and impressive battery life, the Logitech TK820 is well recommended if you're looking to add an external input device to a Windows 8 desktop without a touch screen.
pros: The ergonomic keys on the Logitech TK820 are a pleasure to touch, the integrated touch pad is fully compatible with 13 Windows 8 gestures, four AA batteries last for an impressive six months of use, and the convenient Unifying Receiver plays nicely with other Logitech peripherals
cons: Nighttime users will lament the lack of backlit keys, and there's no indication of remaining battery life

customer_reviews.title: Nice for HTPC use.
customer_reviews.text: Got this to use for my HTPC. It's a better than average keyboard and touchpad. Keys are naturally spaced, I don't have any problems typing on it. Touchpad is nice and big, supports multi-touch and isn't too jittery like some cheaper laptop touchpads. Biggest gripe is that it's not backlit, however I got this for less than half-price as an Amazon Deal of the Day. If not onsale, I'd spend the few extra dollars and get the newer Logitech K830 model which is backlit. I also don't mind the AA batteries, IMHO I'd rather have batteries that I can just swap than a dead keyboard that needs to be plugged in.
customer_reviews.author: John D.

customer_reviews.title: chunky keys, convenient track pad
customer_reviews.text: I'm pretty sure I got a used one. The USB dongle was loose in the box, the outer plastic case was slashed open, and the paper strip used to disconnect the batteries was missing. I contact the seller - ZERO reply after a week. For the keyboard itself, it's ok nothing special. I personally don't like the big chunky keys. I was hoping to get one like my laptop, low profile but am having problems finding one. The large track pad is nice but I've never gotten use to using one for more than few minutes. I'm faster with a mouse or hot keys.
customer_reviews.author: D. Strickland

customer_reviews.title: Mouse pad clicking sucks.
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard is a little to heavy. The way the mouse pad is designed there are issues with clicking. In order to click you have to push far to hard and the entire pad moves with it so the mouse usually moves before the click is processed. I would recommend that you go with another keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Krell

customer_reviews.title: trackpad touch detects back side and off-edges
customer_reviews.text: Great weight and size. The touchpad doesn't work well as it detects fingers near the edges and also behind the keyboard which makes it almost impossible to use on your lap. I'm sure it would work ok on a desk but I am trying, patiently, to use this with a home theatre PC and the trackpad rarely does what I want. Also minus a star because the Logitech driver doesn't let you change scroll direction, so if you're used to using a Mac you have to deal with reverse scrolling and Logitech doesn't care to add a dead-simple software switch to their driver that would make this keyboard that much better.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Poor build quality
customer_reviews.text: The build quality is so bad that an otherwise good product is ruined. The keyboard weighs too much (probably because the 4xAA batteries) and if you move it side to side you can hear rattling throughout the entire case, indicating the interior is poorly constructed. Also, the feel on the touchpad was just terrible. Anytime I pressed the pad down to "click" it would shift the touchpad around in it's casing. The accuracy and sensitivity of the touchpad was okay, but my god the plastic shell around this thing is just awful.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Austin

customer_reviews.title: Keypad replaces mouse - No more sore wrist
customer_reviews.text: I'm an accountant. I use my computer several hours a day. I bought it because no what I did my right wrist was always sore and I was worried about developing carpal tunnel syndrome. This has finally done the trick. No more sore wrists. Obviously a keypad is slower than a mouse. But this is a small price to pay. I also had to buy a G-Combo number pad to enter numbers. I wish Logitech offered a similar keyboard with a number pad. But all in all it works well and I'd recommend this. Everyone should think about this if they or one of their employees has sore wrists.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard, with an awful touch-pad
customer_reviews.text: If you're trying to purchase this, it's probably because you want a keyboard track-pad combo for space saving. Here's my advice-rethink it. The keyboard, like any Logitech is fantastic. Great sensitivity and feel. The trackpad however, is awful. Worst I've ever had the displeasure of touching. It feels like someone in the 90s designed it with parts from the 80s. The tapping is awful, it regularly jumps my mouse when I tap. Clicking is even worse. It doesn't recognize when you click. The track-pad feels super loose, which makes unintentional clicking happen, and happen A LOT. Do yourself a favor and look at the many other Logitech products, get a wireless keyboard and mouse that is not this one.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: -Great build quality -Feels a bit heavy in way that makes it feel comfortable -Grippy feet line the rim of the bottom side ...
customer_reviews.text: Pros: -Great build quality -Feels a bit heavy in way that makes it feel comfortable -Grippy feet line the rim of the bottom side of the keyboard that keep the keyboard from sliding around your lap -Great software additions with 8.1 Cons: -When using my laptop's keyboard I have to reset the mouse/touchpad settings because everything has been reset to the default settings, this has not been an issue with my other plug & play logitech keyboard but something with the software that is installed for the features of this keyboard to work causes problems -Zoom in/out is either too slow or too responsive -Battery dies out pretty easily
customer_reviews.author: SP

customer_reviews.title: Great Keyboard, Ok Trackpad. Hidden HOME END Pg UP pg DOWN buttons
customer_reviews.text: The keys are fantastic. The typing feel is great and the clicking noise is subtle but reassuring. the only reason this is not a 5 stars is because I don't like the track pad, it feels cheap compared to the rest of the keyboard and it is not as responsive as i would like. note: although the HOME, PgUP Pg DOWN and END keys are not labeled they do exist. pressing fn+ arrow UP = PgUP pressing fn+ arrow Down = PgDown pressing fn+ arrow Left = HOME pressing fn+ arrow Right = END I wish logitech would label them but at least is great that the functionality is there
customer_reviews.author: Carlos

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: It's reliable, large & heavy. Feels solid & doesn't move around at all. The batteries last forever (months and months). I find myself almost never using the trackpad, though. The wireless connection is solid unless you have interference (i.e., other devices/wireless dongles) plugged in next to the USB dongle for this keyboard. Pros: Works well. Feels good to type on. Cons: Very heavy if you're traveling (I've traveled with this to 8+ countries.)
customer_reviews.author: Dylan Roscover

customer_reviews.title: Gravity problem
customer_reviews.text: It's quite heavy and feel like quality. Sad part is that more weight means that if it falls on a corner, more mass will push on it and newton its way through the corner... Yeah, mine broke off the corner next to the touch pad. Nevertheless, it's still happily functioning!!! The large touch pad is a blesssing.
customer_reviews.author: dan sim

customer_reviews.title: Takes A Beating And Still Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: When I bought this on Amazon I bought it as a backup. However, I haven't had to use it yet. The first one I bought is still working perfectly despite having dropped it on terrazzo floors many, many times. I use it on my TV so it sits on the couch, and with three dogs, you can imagine how much it goes through. It's cracked in one place, but with as much as it's gone through, it's a miracle it's not worse.
customer_reviews.author: Todd M

customer_reviews.title: Great unit, I may have gotten a defective one though.
customer_reviews.text: Love the keyboard portion, the keys feel right on point and have a nice solid bounce to them. The metal body of the keyboard is also a huge positive as it really gives this device "weight". My biggest problem is with the mouse pad construction, I am not sure if I received a defective unit, but any time I type I can hear the mouse pad vibrating and bouncing in the frame. The push to click is also unresponsive in comparison to tap to click which is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: M. Potapenko

customer_reviews.title: not for Appleware
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard itself seemed to work just fine... with my partner's IBM computer. It did NOT work with my IOS equipment, which I suppose I might have known had I read the promotional info more closely. This keyboard does not work with Apple equipment. It does work, even without its little stick-in piece, with IBM PC equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Windsir

customer_reviews.title: It's just OK for a Mac
customer_reviews.text: While this keyboard works for the Mac, it's not very polished. Scrolling is very rough, and I find myself wanting to use my Macbook pro's built-in touchpad as it's much smoother and has more control. They keyboard itself is good, I quite like the tactile feedback, it has a solid well build feel. The wireless "just works", after the initial keyboard identification sequence, it's been great. The main ding is the touchpad smoothness, which is not a small annoyance. We'll see how it goes.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Gould

customer_reviews.title: Great HTPC or TV Gaming keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I built a PC for my brother to use and he hooked it up to his 50" Plasma TV. He was using a regular corded keyboard and mouse by sitting awkwardly close and uncomfortably. I purchased this for him to be able to kick back and use the PC at a comfortable distance without having to balance a mouse and keyboard on his lap. He has been loving it so far.
customer_reviews.author: J. Burdick

customer_reviews.title: Very good! Update
customer_reviews.text: Very good! Update: I seemed to work well in all aspects. But I found out that the touchpad is almost useless. (if any, it's the moment you don't have a mouse) There is little range of customization of touchpad software. You cannot expect a touchpad of a lowest-end laptop. It's a OK product as a keyboard. If you want to buy this because of the touchpad. Don't. For the money, it deserves one star.
customer_reviews.author: Sang-Hyo Kim

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic keyboard for Windows 8.1, especially if paired with a traditional mouse.
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic keyboard for Windows 8.1, especially when paired with a traditional mouse such as the Logitech Touch Mouse T400. Using the trackpad on this device for gestures/scrolling/pinch to zoom and then a traditional mouse for work that requires more precision, you will have a wonderful Windows 8 experience. While most keyboards are too large for this type of setup, by eliminating the numpad, a trackpad was able to be fit. Thus, you can get the gesture control of a trackpad and buy an additional mouse for pointer precision. Give it a shot!
customer_reviews.author: Ruined

customer_reviews.title: An OK keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Feels good when you type, has a nice large touch pad and the available gestures make navigation faster and convenient. On the down side, it does not have the Home and End keys. The irregular arrangement of some keys (Insert, Delete, arrows) needs some getting used to. Feels a little flimsy since the entire touch pad is a button that can be pressed. Experienced more fatigue in the hand compared to the diNovo Edge keyboard. The F-keys are not the default keys, instead shortcut keys are active, andto do an F5 refresh I first need to press the blue FN key.
customer_reviews.author: OlegOP

customer_reviews.title: Decent keyboard with a subpar trackpad
customer_reviews.text: I almost never review products, but I decided to make an exception for this one. I'm using it with a Macbook Pro and the experience is not great. As a keyboard, it's not bad, though the height is not adjustable. However, as a trackpad/mouse, it's terrible, especially when compared to Macbook's trackpad. It's not responsive enough, has a right-click detection which cannot be disabled. In fact, I couldn't find any way to customize the trackpad on a Mac (it may be different on Windows). Another point of annoyance is that I tend to accidentally brush against the trackpad when using arrow keys. If you do end up using this keyboard, I'd recommend a separate mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Tatiyants

customer_reviews.title: Bad scrolling experience
customer_reviews.text: I bought this all-in-one keyboard to replace my Logitech wireless K400r. The K400r has a very cramped lower right corner, and I was hitting "Page" instead of "Shift." The TK820 has a full-size keyboard--not cramped in the corner. The problem, though, is that the touchpad scrolling function is total rubbish. I reinstalled the unifying software several times, spent almost an hour on the phone with Logitech customer support, and it's still rubbish. The scrolling will start and stop at random and the pointer will jump around the screen. I've gone back to the K400r, even with its cramped corner. I gave the TK820 2 stars because the keyboard is nice--but the touchpad is not.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Williams

customer_reviews.title: Solid keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Been using it for awhile now and have had a great experience so far. The weight of the keyboard was nice. I like a bit of weight to my tech. Keys are great. track pad is nice and large (, makes using my 32" in 1080p effortless. This was my tipping point when deciding (I've used the TK400 and it is light, and the track pad is small). Gesture support and all that is great. Only caveat: track pad seems to rest on a spring...reminiscent of blackberry storm...but not THAT bad. so yea clicking in far corners requires a bit more force but overall the click feel is decent.
customer_reviews.author: JD on AMZN

customer_reviews.title: Very good for what it is
customer_reviews.text: The keys only depress as much as a laptop's, is not backlit, but it is still the closest Windows analogue to the lovely Apple Keyboard and trackpad. This was my daily driver for about two years, and has been used for our family HTPC since. It worked fine at my desk (no comparison to a mechanical keyboard of course), and has taken a lot of abuse in our living room. Logitech should definitely update this with a backlit version with better keys, a Precision Touchpad, and bluetooth. The K830 doesn't look as nice or have a large enough trackpad.
customer_reviews.author: Ali

customer_reviews.title: Useful and wireless!
customer_reviews.text: I received this as a gift because I liked the idea of using my TV monitor as a second screen sometimes (or when playing things onto my TV from my computer). I can click around my laptop without getting up. I can just set my laptop up next to my computer and then use the keyboard to navigate. I love the added mousepad too. You can do multifinger commands and the keyboard is very comfortable. I bought one of these as a gift for my father and he likes his too.
customer_reviews.author: RunningGal

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Key Board
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this now for several months with the computer hooked up to my big screen TV. Love the wireless. I sit 23+ foot back from the TV screen and this keyboard and touchpad response well with no lags. And the touchpad is large enough that my fingers don't run off of the pad when I'm not looking down at it. The board is easy to store and balanced well. At first I didn't like the fact that I had to use batteries, but the batteries have lasted a good long time thanks to the shut off switch when not in use that is on the board itself. I would recommend this to anyone. A+ Logitech!
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: Bought on  January 20, 2014.
customer_reviews.text: Finally died today. It repeatedly loses charge within 24 hrs after changing batteries. 1/20/2014-6/20/2019. Good Run!
customer_reviews.author: Brian T

customer_reviews.title: Best Keyboard I have found for my living room PC
customer_reviews.text: Best Keyboard I have found for my living room PC. Large track pad area is a great. This is the second one I bought as I like them so much. Also find this as a quick way to move keyboard between systems. Works great with my HTPC, RasberryPi, Laptop, and more. Very surprised that I do not like the newer model, it just not seem to be as good of remote keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Micheal E. Weinfurtner

customer_reviews.title: Poor build quality!
customer_reviews.text: For a keyboard of this price, I expected a better build quality. It was exactly want I wanted as I have recently come to appreciate a smart trackpad and its scrolling features on Windows 10. But the typing experience was horrendous. It wasn't the layout of the keys as much as this cheap rattle of plastic as I would type. Not the tactile click of a keyboard but as though something was lose. Disappointing, as its a great product concept and excellent visual design. Would have liked mini stands to angle the keyboard had I kept it.
customer_reviews.author: Hormazd

customer_reviews.title: I wanted a keyboard with a nice big touchpad
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a keyboard with a nice big touchpad, and this one is the nicest of them all. I don't use any fancy features, but the basic design seems very good. Edit: having used this for over a year now, I've found it very frustrating. The range is weak and it cuts out if I'm not right next to my computer. It is a nice looking keyboard, but now that I've used the cheaper model, which works better, I feel like I got ripped off.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Not great.
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is reliable on a desk for normal use, but the keyboard (mostly the trackpad) has some serious issues... 1) It eats through batteries very quickly if not turned off 2) The range is pretty bad. Can't use it across the room in front of my TV 3) The trackpad is very loose, and the clicking of the single button is not very tight. It's hard to 'click' without moving the mouse as well. 4) Not good for use on a lap... needs to be sitting on a desk or table, so it's not good for home theater/living room use. Very frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: M. Gillman

customer_reviews.title: I use it daily
customer_reviews.text: I have 6 of these because they no longer make them. The track pad is not the greatest but I do like how easy it is to type on.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Wilson

customer_reviews.title: it's not a bad keyboard, but I bought this because I was ...
customer_reviews.text: it's not a bad keyboard, but I bought this because I was expecting a much better experience. At more than double the price of the cheaper logitech, I expected the trackpad to be far superior but I can't say there is that much difference from the $20 logitech. It does have a better build and it's much heavier but for a media center, that's not a better thing. It's ok but not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Joon Kim

customer_reviews.title: Excellent.
customer_reviews.text: I love the Logitech touchpads that allow advanced gestures. They are much better than the cheaper all-in-one keyboards that only allow as much functionality as the touchpad on a regular laptop. This is a sturdy keyboard that works well. My only wish is that there was a model with the touchpad on the left.
customer_reviews.author: ElectronicsJunkie III

customer_reviews.title: Mostly a disappontment
customer_reviews.text: First, for the price I expected more features and a much more user friendly setup. Too many controls have been eliminated from keyboard and the media usable keys after being programmed would require a note pad nearby to remember. Second, to not allow a rechargable internal battery and instead to expect the consumer to feed it batteries is not what the price would indicate. Much better units out there for less money.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Prather

customer_reviews.title: "unresponsive" is putting it mildly. avoid at all costs. wish i had.
customer_reviews.text: search reviews for "unresponsive". You'll get a lot of hits. If it needs translation - "unresponsive" - you type or use the touchpad & nothing happens. What a fantastic feature. update the firmware, switch usb ports, reboot your pc....still...within an hour....nothing happens. I've done enough searches for the combination of tk820 & "unresponsive" to now know that logitech MUST know this is a substandard design - should NOT have shipped to customers. They have enormous gall to continue to sell it. Stay away at all costs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome keyboard.  Love the touch pad.
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected. Fits in my laptop bag. Only issue I had was when using the back button. Several times it deleted 15 characters or so, when I depressed the button 2 or 3 times. I am using Windiws 7. I reinstalled the software and have not had any further issues with the keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Good for a portable device.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a combo , keyboard and mouse for my windows 8 tablet and PC. Pros : size is portable Easy on/off switch Mouse pad touch gestures Responsive Cons : over sensitive mouse pad Not an amazing device but works wee for what I needed. Great size and weight, doesn't feel that cheap. Mouse pad is not as good as I wanted but works. Not good as a main keyboard. Definitely not a gaming board.
customer_reviews.author: christopher papasmiris

customer_reviews.title: Awesome HTPC touchpad, but why the click?
customer_reviews.text: Typing this review with the keyboard. Bought this for my HTPC specifically for the huge touchpad. It's awesome, but i didn't know it clicked until i received it. This pad has the option to click the bottom portion for left and right clicks. It's a little sensitive so you end up clicking sometimes when you don't mean to. Don't buy the $25 one with the smaller touchpad for HTPCs, you want this one!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: looks sleek feels good
customer_reviews.text: no page up/down/home/end or dedicated function keys. tricky to get the function keys (F1/F2 etc) enabled without pushing Fn through the logitech software. The track pad works like a dream and support gestures. good keyboard for limited use such ash HTPC. not so good for everday workstation use such as a cad/dev workstation. decent range. at least 40 feet through walls and a floor.
customer_reviews.author: Wa Lee

customer_reviews.title: Windows detected drivers and installed it but keyboard was like dead. It's not right to sell not-working devices
customer_reviews.text: keyboard didn't work on my 3 PCs with new batteries. Windows detected drivers and installed it but keyboard was like dead. It's not right to sell not-working devices. Do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Bekzod Fakhriddinov

customer_reviews.title: Great combo keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: I'm currently using this with a Windows 7 pc. It works well. What you I didn't realize but love is that the keyboard has weight to it. I think that is what makes it pricey. I haven't had a keyboard feel that sturdy since I had an IBM PC XT. I guess that shows my age. Very well made product. All keyboard makers should use this as a template.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: This keyboard is excellent! I have limited use of my hands
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is excellent! I have limited use of my hands, so I purchased it because of the touchpad which has allowed me to almost entirely get by without using the traditional mouse. This keyboard is a blessing to me!
customer_reviews.author: BJ Myers

customer_reviews.title: missing some key functionality, but still sweet
customer_reviews.text: love this thing, only would like to see page up/down and home/end somewhere. pretty much every other kb of this ilk has this as a function of the arrow keys, not so here. but still, the giant track pad is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: inertman

customer_reviews.title: HATE IT
customer_reviews.text: This is an ill conceived product. The track pad's proximity to the keyboard results in erroneous touches which results in errors in typed text. I don't see any means to just turn the track pad off.
customer_reviews.author: JEM

customer_reviews.title: A few bugs
customer_reviews.text: When you're entering text into a field on the internet, it will spaz out and paste like 300 of the character you wanted to type. Also, now, whenever I try to Ctrl+Click with the right control key, it doesn't register the control...still works with the right control key for some reason....I would not buy this again if I could find a better option
customer_reviews.author: Zane Hitchcox

customer_reviews.title: I thought I needed a mouse, I was wrong.
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard proves that the mouse can die. You don't need to give up the space. You can be faster. You don't need to pick up your hand to move it over to the mouse. Much more efficient. Wonderful ergonomics. Logitech's new keys are great to the touch, too. This keyboard saves you space on your desk, and eliminates any need for a new monitor for full windows 8 functionality.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Fischer

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I decided to go with a full keyboard solution for my home theater PC. I love the wireless connectivity and the responsiveness of the keyboard itself. Only missing feature, in my opinion, is a backlight option. Having illuminated keys for those lightless situations would be great. Small gripe, but something worth mentioning.
customer_reviews.author: Collin Peebles

customer_reviews.title: One of the best purchases of the year for me...
customer_reviews.text: One of the best purchases of the year for me...I can lean back and still be connected to the laptop without pulling my back, lol, plus on top of that some of the keys on the laptop are not working and the repair people want $200 plus just to fix it...I could buy a new laptop or just pick up one of these babies, way worth it ;-)
customer_reviews.author: GREEK

customer_reviews.title: I do like that it has a hard off switch and the ...
customer_reviews.text: The touchpad rocks on mouse clicks, it really should have had seperate buttons, and since the first day has never seemed to fit back into the right place. Also sometimes it seems to drop connection and picks back up later but once it's happen it seems to occur with increasing frequency. I do like that it has a hard off switch and the keyboard it self seems mostly fine despite the connection issues. I may end up trying to sell and grab a logitech k830 instead.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Horton IV

customer_reviews.title: Very nice to have the trackpad and keyboard together.
customer_reviews.text: I like having the trackpad and keyboard together. It takes up a lot less space on the desk and the gesture support from logitech is great. My only complaint is that the process of dragging and dropping is not as good as with the mouse. In all other regards its better. So I keep my logitech mouse readily available and it all works out.
customer_reviews.author: buddy

customer_reviews.title: Warning! Don't drop slippery keyboard. It will break.
customer_reviews.text: 1st off. Everything about this keyboard is pretty awesome. All the claims made by the manufacturer are pretty spot on. So no grief with that. For a while i thought. dang. this is a silly expensive keyboard but it sure does feel nice and sleek. Then that sleek feeling turned into a liability when it dropped from my lap to my floor. To it's credit the device still works just as well as it ever did. its just literally unhinged. This happened a mere 3 days after the expansive 30 day warranty. lol. oh well. hope you have padded floors!
customer_reviews.author: The Dean Team

customer_reviews.title: useless trackpad
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is horrible, the shape size and design is beautiful.. But the trackpad is useless, unresponsive and can't do basic functions like click or maneuver the cursor, it's just a waste of space.. I've never been this disappointed with a Logitech product like I am with this one this before. Now I'm not sure if this is how it's suppose to be or if this keyboard is broken, I did receive this keyboard in a smashed box but didn't think of it, and kept using another mouse until I started using the trackpad.
customer_reviews.author: Abdulla Al N

customer_reviews.title: Touchpad doesn't work properly, there are 4 vertical zones ...
customer_reviews.text: Touchpad doesn't work properly, there are 4 vertical zones, where thouchpad doesn't work at all: 3-4 mm from left and right front and 2 zones about 1cm inside touchpad area. So, working zone is only about 3 cm in center of toucpad. This is big fail of Logitech and big fail of amazon too, because I see reviews with the same issues for the last 3 mounths.
customer_reviews.author: Bigbig

customer_reviews.title: Best all-in-one keyboard ever!
customer_reviews.text: Buy it! This is the best all-in-one keyboard/touchpad. I've tried lots of them and this is definitely the best. For a home theater PC this keyboard rocks. I have one of these on my Home Theater PC, and one on my raspberry pi at work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I found the touch pad to be very responsive. I got rid of my clunky mouse. The keyboard is sleek and thin. The keys are nice to touch. There is a switch on top to turn it off. The drivers are easy to install. It has more functions in Windows 8 than 7, but works fine in both. The pad has right and left click. Its easy to transport if needed.
customer_reviews.author: drpret

customer_reviews.title: Acceptable, Not good, Definitely not great
customer_reviews.text: CONS (aka tl;dr) trackpad is significantly lacking; it has a matte finish which feels like an unpolished product, when clicking your finger is still tracked so the cursor slips, taping could lessen the sensitivity of the cursor moving as well the keyboard itself is quite heavy because of the batteries, sometimes helpful and other times not. PROS nice to type on, compact layout, rubber on bottom keeps it from slipping on flat surfaces Recommend? No, there's better keyboards for this price and way better logitech keyboards
customer_reviews.author: Simon Partridge

customer_reviews.title: good for couch PC, a few weird behaviors
customer_reviews.text: I'm basically happy with this -- the touchpad is great and the windows 8 gestures work well, The typing is fine too. There are some odd behaviors I haven't figured out. Seems like if you press the backspace key too many times it functions as a back button in a web browser. Also sometimes when I'm typing a message in gmail it randomly initiates a new email. I can't figure out what I'm accidentally pressing to cause that. Also Alt F4 doesn't work right, even though I'm doing function+Alt+F4. If I could iron out those problems, it would be five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Baumer

customer_reviews.title: Best keyboard ever!!
customer_reviews.text: I do t do many reviews, but this keyboard is the best ever! Great touch, solid feel. The touch pad was not intuitive, however, once I went on line and found instructions I realized WOW this thing really simplifies use of a mouse. Trade in whatever you are using and get this. I am ordering my third one for my own use today!
customer_reviews.author: RiderRalph

customer_reviews.title: Works only OK in Linux
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard and touchpad work OK in Ubuntu 13.10. The touchpad shows up basically as a mouse... one finger moves the mouse cursor, two finger scrolling emulates a mouse wheel. One tap is left click, two finger tap is right click. Three finger drag down gives Super-L+d, three fingers up gives Super-L x 2. The underlying physical buttons work as expected. I was kinda hoping the touchpad would provide, well, a touchpad. I'd actually like to use the 3- and 4-finger unity gestures, but no luck. I love the feel of the keyboard for typing, and the touch functions that are provided are fine (as good as a mouse).
customer_reviews.author: Chris K

customer_reviews.title: Love it - use it everyday
customer_reviews.text: AMAZiNG keyboard/trackpad combo. ITs replacing a magic keyboard and trackpad from apple and i get consistent signal strength and trackpad tracking form around 7/8 ft away (HTPC connected to a Samsung 65") where apple's kb/tp had jerky and erratic connection. Would love if it were backlit, but it has an excellent battery life.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Multi-gesture pad is not as good as it should be
customer_reviews.text: Multi-gesture pad is not as good as it should be... I am not comfortable with the multi gesture. It does not give you a comfortable control to navigate the screen as compare to laptop pads. It price is almost $100 and in this price, it should be perfectly functioning with a good control.
customer_reviews.author: salman siddique

customer_reviews.title: Bought for use with Chromebox
customer_reviews.text: Overall this is a decent keyboard/touchpad combo. It can be flaky with Chrome OS at times by lagging or becoming unresponsive, but this could be a fault of Chrome itself. My main issue is that the touchpad "clicks", the slightest pressure registers a mouse click, so when using Chrome gestures such as double tap you end up with multiple taps. Mouse pointer is really laggy and in Chrome there isn't really any mouse adjustments you can make to speed up pointer movement. ( this may be a a feature they are working on). Overall it is a decent keyboard combo, built well and nice price. I have used Logitech products for ages and have always been happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hooverman

customer_reviews.title: Work with KDE on Linux
customer_reviews.text: I bought it (track pad) to save time from reaching out for mouse, and my keyboard tray does not have much space. It works with KDE on Linux. I can do select-copy-paste all on the track pad. "Paste", for example, is a three-finger-tap, which simulates the middle-button. Swipe left and right works on Firefox browser to go back and forth between pages. The first one I ordered has manufacturing defect, the 2nd one works great.
customer_reviews.author: kko

customer_reviews.title: Nice keyboard, trackpad not so much
customer_reviews.text: This is a very well made keyboard, except for having the worst trackpad I've ever used. Between the dead spot in the middle of it and the lack of responsiveness, it's just awful. Not to mention trying to right-click or left-click, it just doesn't work well at all. Other than that it's a nice keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Ken R.

customer_reviews.title: I really enjoy using this keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy using this keyboard. 4 stars because the click action of the touchpad is less than ideal. But otherwise it works great, I like the key placement, and the batteries last for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Slyons

customer_reviews.title: Get one while you can!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these keyboards! They're weighted quite nicely. the battery life is absolutely amazing! We're talking changing once a year!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Hall

customer_reviews.title: so good. After a couple months
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. After a couple months, it works well. Have plenty of batteries handy. I'm not good at turning mine off. When it gets flakey, I put fresh batteries in and all is well. The touch pad is nearly as good as my MacBook.
customer_reviews.author: Tech Guy

customer_reviews.title: good keyboard touchpad combo
customer_reviews.text: I like the keyboard it meets my expectations. Since I don't have a touch screen monitor this works as a good substitute The keyboard is well made with windows 8 touch and swipe. But sometimes the touch and swipe does not respond. I am not sure if it’s the keyboard or windows 8 But overall I am pleased with it
customer_reviews.author: Rich Rouquette

customer_reviews.title: Love the nice big trackpad
customer_reviews.text: I got this to control my HTPC, and it works very well. Love the nice big trackpad, love the on/off switch that is right on top. It is a bit flimsy in the hand, because of the thin sleek construction, but that hasn't been a problem so far.
customer_reviews.author: aschmu

customer_reviews.title: VERY HAPPY!!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent!! I love this keyboard!! Touch pad works great and the keys are really smooth. Great range and seems to be very well made. The shape is very elegant and classy. This blows the cheaper Logitech keyboards out of the water!!
customer_reviews.author: D.K. Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Deceived
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t use it and I throw it away and the cause is its keyboard is not in English and the notes are misplaced. It’s so stupid, what I saw in picture doesn’t match what I’ve got
customer_reviews.author: Alix

customer_reviews.title: Best wireless kbd for Win8
customer_reviews.text: Super duper. On Windows 8.1, I mated it with my wireless Logitech M570 trackball on the same receiver ... The main attraction of this wireless keyboard is the massive builtin mousepad, which does ALL of the Windows 8.x gestures even without a touchscreen.
customer_reviews.author: D.B. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Pretty decent media keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Pretty decent media keyboard. The keys feel great, but the touchpad can be finnicky at times. Might just be my skin, but it doesn't always register multi-finger input like scrolling, etc. probably just need to fiddle with the sensitivity.
customer_reviews.author: Mike W

customer_reviews.title: Keyboard in livingroom setting.
customer_reviews.text: The mouse is a little skittish if you don't set it up right. The keyboard doesn't light up. Some of Logitech's other keyboard will plug into a usb port and charge, but don't have the mouse. But it's better than trying to use an Apple peripheral on bootcamp; talk about some half-assed drivers.
customer_reviews.author: Ely Glaser

customer_reviews.title: Keyboard is fine..
customer_reviews.text: Keyboard is fine... the touchpad is terribly inconsistent. Sometimes it will scroll, sometimes it will click once, sometimes it will double click. Sometimes I find myself remote-ing to the machine it's attached to rather than having to use the touchpad.
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: For me, a good purchase
customer_reviews.text: I really like the larger touch pad, it has many advanced features, but it's not without it's drawbacks however. Using a function key is a two handed exercise, which is different from my older keyboard, but the plus side of this is that my hands are not touching the touch pad as I type, so you must decide what is more important to you as you consider this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: HMac

customer_reviews.title: Good keyboard, bad touchpad
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard button themselves feel great to down on but don't expect much of the touchpad. The clicking feature didn't work well for me at all. Far less superiors than Apple's. Did not replace my mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Samer Kamal

customer_reviews.title: I wouldn't recommend it for anything more than occasional use
customer_reviews.text: The touchpad is very squishy and not the most reactive. I don't have to use it often, so it's not that big of a deal. I wouldn't recommend it for anything more than occasional use.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Ourada

customer_reviews.title: Breeze to set up, works Great!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't have to install any software, plugged in, let the computer find the driver, started working. mouse pad works great, works across my living room through the door of my entertainment center. Would highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: TMCLEN

customer_reviews.title: Love this keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Love this keyboard. The keys are smooth and silent and the trackpad is great. It get stuck sometimes though but not too often
customer_reviews.author: marley777

customer_reviews.title: Nice till it stops working.
customer_reviews.text: Nice till it stops working. My b key lno longer works, essentially making it useless.
customer_reviews.author: Ziloni

customer_reviews.title: There is always a better one that comes out after I purchase things like ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent keyboard. It works without fail. There is always a better one that comes out after I purchase things like this but this is a great product. Logitech has always made top quality products!!
customer_reviews.author: Sunmaid

customer_reviews.title: High Quality but No NUM keypad
customer_reviews.text: You sacrifice the NUM keypad, Home, End, etc. keys. The huge touchpad has a lot of useful gestures, but I always forget them. Top quality construction, but I end up using my M325 mouse and suffering without HOME and END.
customer_reviews.author: Peyton

customer_reviews.title: The big brother of K300r
customer_reviews.text: It is a bit expensive, but worth every penny. Large touch pad area, multi-point gestures and comfortable typing. I own it along side it's little brother Logitech K300r which suffers from a major bug in the hardware. (read my review about that)
customer_reviews.author: F.K

customer_reviews.title: Often Missing Input both Keyboard and Mouse
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard/mouse combo can sometimes miss your input if its not regularly operating on a flat surface. I find the K400 more reliable (but smaller)
customer_reviews.author: DaMaestro

customer_reviews.title: There isn't a "Home" or "End" button on the keyboard
customer_reviews.text: There isn't a "Home" or "End" button on the keyboard. This keyboard is useless without them. I even tried to change the swipe defaults and cannot. If I could somehow set 3 fingers swipe left/right to be home/end I would change this rating... So sad :(
customer_reviews.author: Kevin S

customer_reviews.title: Great range, however the touchpad is awkward and the connection is spotty
customer_reviews.text: The unit sometimes requires being turned off/on to establish a connection. Range is otherwise good. The touchpad is somewhat difficult to use, and the "pushing down" part can be annoying. I realize you can use the tapping method, but the ability to push down still distracts sometimes.
customer_reviews.author: Brian M

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly to expectations
customer_reviews.text: Love the tactile feedback from the keyboard. Don't use the touchpad much. No issues in the past 2 months of usage. A bit pricey compared with other options, but the build quality is commensurate with the price.
customer_reviews.author: B. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Very good!
customer_reviews.text: Works fine! Very good range, about 6 meters with no issues. Touchpad sometimes need a second click to work, bue in general sensitivity is above average. Good build quality as expected.
customer_reviews.author: FT

customer_reviews.title: Works on Windows 8.1
customer_reviews.text: Works great on my Mom's laptop and it is actually pretty thin and the touchpad works in parallel with a mouse too
customer_reviews.author: Danny H. Newport

customer_reviews.title: ... should be solid instead of a clicker but not bad for the price
customer_reviews.text: i think the touchpad should be solid instead of a clicker but not bad for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: was not for me
customer_reviews.text: The keypad does not track smoothly in Window 8.1. I use a different keypad, Logitech T650, on another PC and do not have issues with tracking. Product returned.
customer_reviews.author: KKS

customer_reviews.title: Works great but I eventually upgraded to the K830 for the ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great but I eventually upgraded to the K830 for the illuminated keys. I greatly preferred the much larger touchpad on the K820 though.
customer_reviews.author: Simkow

customer_reviews.title: I bought this keyboard solely for the looks. Kind ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this keyboard solely for the looks. Kind of expensive for what it is - just a membrane keyboard. Weak key action. Lacks Home and End keys which for me is rather crippling. Touchpad and gestures work well.
customer_reviews.author: RaGe

customer_reviews.title: Keyboard did not work after first day in use
customer_reviews.text: Keyboard was working great on the first day, second, did not work, NO on/off light, changed batteries, connected to another laptop, changed USB ports, spoke to logitech, with respect, they said Amazon is responsible for repair/replacement, Now i am in UK, i can return the item to US Amazon, but replacement cannot be delivered to UK address. So, finally i have decided that my time with Logitech product has been wasted
customer_reviews.author: Satya

customer_reviews.title: Keyboard TK 820
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't to happy having to use a Unifier in my only USB port on my Surface, but other wise after adjusting the speed of the touchpad this is a great keyboard. Feels solid, keys feel good and touch pad is one of the b3est I have ever used.
customer_reviews.author: grisrenard

customer_reviews.title: Nice, quality construction and luxurious feel.
customer_reviews.text: this is a very beautiful product. I use it for my media center computer and having the over sized trackpad is beneficial for this purpose when using a 60" screen it seems more appropriate.
customer_reviews.author: gregory j.

customer_reviews.title: Fits perfectly on a 19" rack shelf.
customer_reviews.text: No real complaints. I miss having properly sized arrow keys and dedicated home/end keys, but these are reasonable compromises to make room for the touchpad.
customer_reviews.author: Delaminator

customer_reviews.title: I am very impressed!
customer_reviews.text: This is an ideal keyboard/touchpad for use with an HTPC - I couldn't be more pleased with how very well it functions. The design is clean and classy and the build-quality is excellent!
customer_reviews.author: kerbe

customer_reviews.title: Track pad takes a little time to get comfortable with but works fine otherwise.
customer_reviews.text: Works ok but using the track pad takes some getting used too. I using it on a Home Theater PC and it does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Michael D.

product_meta.title: Logitech Wireless All-In-One Keyboard TK820 with Built-In Touchpad
product_meta.description:
View larger

LOGITECH WIRELESS ALL-IN-ONE KEYBOARD TK820
EFFORTLESSLY TYPE AND SWIPE ON ONE DEVICE.
This innovative keyboard seamlessly integrates typing, touch and gestures. So now you have everything you need to control and navigate your computer in one device. With a large, built-in touch pad, you can type and swipe comfortably together. It’s a new way to navigate—especially in Windows 8.

KEY FEATURES
 * Keyboard with built-in touchpad
 * Large touch surface supports Windows 8 gestures
 * Ultra-slim, space-saving design
 * Logitech advanced key technology for smooth, comfortable typing
 * Robust wireless connection with tiny Unifying receiver
 * Compatible with Windows 8 and Windows 7

View largerKEYBOARD WITH BUILT-IN TOUCHPAD
The keyboard and touchpad are seamlessly integrated, so you can:

 * Use one device for typing, touch and gestures 
 * Switch between using the keyboard and touchpad smoothly and effortlessly
 * Type on the keyboard and simultaneously point, zoom and swipe on the touchpad

View larger WIRELESS, SPACE-SAVING DESIGN 
 * Ultra-slim design takes up less space on your desk
 * Connects wirelessly to your computer, so there are no cables to get in the way 
 * Integrated touchpad gives you simplified navigation without needing a separate mouse

View largerLARGE TOUCH AREA WITH INTEGRATED CLICK
It’s larger than a laptop touchpad, giving you more room to:

 * Point, zoom, pinch, swipe, scroll and click more freely 
 * Perform Windows 8 gestures comfortably and smoothly 
 * Control your cursor more precisely

PERFECTSTROKE KEY SYSTEM WITH INCURVE KEYS
Experience superior typing comfort thanks to Logitech’s advanced key technology:

 * The PerfectStroke key system distributes typing pressure evenly across the key surfaces. Every keystroke feels smooth and whisper-quiet—even if you strike the edge of a key. 
 * Incurve keys with softly rounded edges help your fingers glide across the keyboard. Typing feels fluid and comfortable, hour after hour.

FULL RANGE OF MULTI-TOUCH GESTURES
 * Touchpad supports up to 13 unique Windows 8 gestures
 * Use edge gestures to switch apps and bring up the Charms Bar
 * Return to the Start Screen with a simple three-finger swipe
 * See the Windows 8 gestures

View larger UNIFYING RECEIVER WITH ADVANCED 2.4 GHZ WIRELESS
 * Robust wireless connection allows you to type with the keyboard on your desk or even on your lap
 * Hassle-free setup—plug the tiny Unifying receiver into your computer and start typing (no need to ever unplug it) 
   Learn More >
 * Fast, reliable data transmission with virtually no delays or dropouts

COMPATIBILITY
WHAT'S IN THE BOX
 * Wireless All-in-One Keyboard 
 * 4 AA batteries (pre-installed) 
 * USB Unifying receiver 
 * User documentation 

WORKS WITH:
 * Windows 8, Windows 7
 * Computer with available USB port
 * Internet connection for software download

COMPARE
WHICH LOGITECH WIRELESS KEYBOARD IS RIGHT FOR YOU?
Good

Better 

Best



Wireless Keyboard K360



 Wireless Solar Keyboard K750



All-in-One Keyboard TK820

What Do You Get?Stylish space-saving keyboard for a relaxed typing experienceA light-powered keyboard that charges itself whenever there’s lightBuilt-in touchpad for typing and swiping with one deviceConnection ChoicesUSB SupportAdvanced Wireless:
Fast, powerful 2.4 GHz connection with 128-bit AES encryptionUnifying Receiver:
Tiny wireless receiver stays in your notebookKeyboard DesignKeyboard LayoutCompactFull SizeMinimalistProfileThinUltra-thin Ultra-thin Integrated TouchpadIntegrated Number PadPerfectStroke™ Key systemIncurve™ keysControlsWindows 8 Start keyWindows 8 Charms bar shortcutsProgrammable F-Keys:
Download additional software to change or define functionsEnhanced F-Keys: Give you additional functions on top of your F-keysSearch FeatureSystem SupportWindows XP, VistaWindows 7, 8**Older keyboard models listed in above chart have only basic functionality on Windows RT. Software and app support aren't available for this platform. Older keyboard models listed in above chart will provide basic navigation in Windows 8 style UI. Features programmed in SetPoint software may not function in this mode.

Note: Logitech mice and keyboards are Human Interface Devices (HID). HID drivers are native to modern Windows operating systems, enabling basic functionality without the need for other software. To use enhanced features, such as programming keys and buttons, additional software may be required. See the product's Support page > Downloads tab for software availability on www.logitech.com


CREATE THE COMBO THAT WORKS FOR YOU
Logitech has a range of portable and full-size mice that you can connect via a single, tiny receiver you leave plugged in to your laptop or keyboard. Now you can create your perfect workspace, wherever you work.

Logitech Performance Mouse MX
With the full-size Logitech Performance Mouse MX, you’ll have the power to achieve. You can track precisely on more surfaces—even glass tables (4 mm minimum thickness)—thanks to Logitech Darkfield Laser Tracking.

Logitech Anywhere Mouse MX
The portable Anywhere Mouse MX works wherever you do. Thanks to Logitech Darkfield Laser Tracking, you’ll get precise cursor control on virtually any surface, even glass tables (4 mm minimum thickness) where optical and standard laser mice fail.

Logitech Wireless Mouse M510
With its contoured shape, soft rubber grips and handy controls, the Logitech Wireless Mouse M510 gives you more control, so you can do more with your mouse.

Logitech Zone Touch Mouse T400
Comfortable hybrid mouse for essential Windows 8 navigation with a touch zone for vertical/horizontal scrolling plus familiar left, right, and middle buttons.

Logitech Wireless Mouse M325
A better mix of precision and comfort. With its designed-for-Web scrolling, now everything you love to do online is easier.*


* Designed to improve your online experience, the wheel also helps perfect scrolling when you're using other applications, such as Microsoft Office or Adobe PDF
feature_bullets: All-in-one keyboard with built-in touchpad: Type and swipe on one device for effortless computer control and navigation
Large touch surface: Point, zoom and perform Windows 8 gestures comfortably and smoothly (also works with Windows 7)
Sleek, space-saving design: Ultra-slim, cable-free design reduces clutter on your desk
Perfect Stroke and Incurve keys: Experience fluid, comfortable typing with Logitech's advanced key technology
Unifying receiver with advanced 2.4 GHz wireless: Fast, reliable wireless connection gives you the freedom to type on your desk or lap

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.6 out of 5 stars412 ratings3.6 out of 5 stars
